8 items in one folder
1859, 1867-1874 Seven invoices from dealers directed to Ferdinand C. Ruehrmund for gloves, hats, collars, umbrellas, and other such goods he purchased. Ruehrmund (1825-1884) was an immigrant from Germany, who owned a store from 1858-1863 in Caledonia, Ohio, and from 1867-1879 in Marion, Ohio. Dealers represented are George Chapman & Co.; Bartlett Beery & Co.; William J. Peake & Co.; Daniel Hoffman & Co.; Lewis, Titus & Cooke (with a transmittal letter allowing a credit); Ives, Murphy & Gore; and Clark Brothers & Co. All dealers are from New York City. The Chapman invoice dates from 1859 and is directed to Ruehrmund in Caledonia; the others date from his time in business in Marion.
